leaflet.candidateName: Stephen Ng, Tom Ogg, Marian Spall

messages.title: Why Islington Labour is different.
messages.content: Islington Labour Councillors pay the highest London living wage and give their salaries away to local charities rather than take the same high pay that the Lib Dems pocketed.

messages.title: Jeremy Corbyn MP says:
messages.content: "We need a Labour Council to help all those in desperate housing, need and to ensure decent opportunities for our young people. Please vote for our Hillrise Team."

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will work hard to keep our A&E unit and fully support the Save the Whittington Coalition.
We will crack down on crime and gang culture, particularly anti-social behaviour on the Elthorne Estate.

We will work with Homes for Islington to make sure there is adequate funding for structural repairs on our estates, and the rules enforced. We will seek a resolution to the long-running damp problem on Elthorne.
We will work towards getting Hillside Park refurbished and the children's play area reinstated. We will clean up Parkland Walk after years of neglect.
We will work towards getting better youth facilities in Hillrise, and will support existing facilities.
We will work with the Better Archway forum, support moves to remove the gyratory system, and promote local shops and businesses.

mentions.candidate: Stephen Ng, Tom Ogg, Marian Spall
mentions.tacticalSituation: In Islington now, it's Labour vs. the Tories.

issues.education: Supports free school meals for all of Islington's primary school children.
issues.health: Support Whittington Hospital to keep the A&E unit and fully support the Save the Whittington Coalition.

housing.content: We need a Labour Council to help all those in desperate housing, need and to ensure decent opportunities for our young people.

endorsements.endorsement: "We need a Labour Council to help all those in desperate housing, need and to ensure decent opportunities for our young people. Please vote for our Hillrise Team."

quotes.text: In tough times, their priority is to give a tax cut to the 3,000 wealthiest people in the country—whilst cutting 1 in 5 Sure Start centres.

Islington Labour does not run the Council, we have successfully fought for: Free school meals for all primary school children More affordable housing for our young people and those in need Local jobs and Council apprenticeships.

images.caption: Stephen Ng, Tom Ogg, and Marian Spall, your Hillrise Labour team for Council

leaflet.additionalNotes: Best wishes, Jeremy Corbyn MP, Stephen Ng, Tom Ogg, Marian Spall.
